page.title: 06MUSEUM OF LINCOLNSHIRE LIFE
page.content:
This was established in 1969 to show the domestic agricultural and social life of the county over the last 200 years. The Museum is housed in the Old Barracks which was built in 1857 for the Loyal North Lincoln Militia and later became the Headquarters of the Lincolnshire Yeomanry. The collection put together by members of the Lincolnshire Local History Society formed the nucleus of the museum which was set up in the gatehouse of the Old Barracks in Burton Road. Since that time the collection had increased in size so quickly that the museum had to be made larger.
See Page 7 for further details.
